required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Safety and Immunogenicity of GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) Biologicals' Herpes Zoster Subunit (HZ/su) Vaccine in Adults Aged 18 Years and Older With Blood Cancers
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Evaluate Safety and Immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' Herpes Zoster Vaccine GSK1437173A in Adults Aged 18 Years and Older With Haematologic Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' vaccine GSK1437173A in subjects aged 18 years and older with blood cancers. The study will evaluate safety-related events and antibody and cellular immune responses to the study vaccine, as compared to placebo.

detailed_description.textblock:
Amendment to protocol posting:
Increase in sample size, update of country/region-specific information (Sections 5, 6 and 9).
Promotion of secondary to primary objective; related update of primary and secondary outcome measures (Sections 4 and 7).

primary_outcome.measure: Vaccine Response Rates (VRR) for Anti-glycoprotein E (Anti-gE) Antibody Concentrations
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA). Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 greater than or equal to (≥) 4 fold the cut-off for Anti-gE [4x97 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL)]. For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody concentration. This analysis was performed on subjects with haematologic malignancies excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Geometric Mean Concentration of Anti-gE Antibodies
primary_outcome.description: The Adjusted geometric mean concentration was measured in all subjects excluding those with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
primary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Days With Solicited Local Symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms: pain, redness, swelling and their number of days were recorded after each vaccination dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
primary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms (included nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain), headache, myalgia, shivering and fever [defined as oral, axillary or tympanic route measured temperature equal to or above 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptom = symptom that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Days With Solicited General Symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Solicited general symptoms: fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache, myalgia, shivering, temperature and their number of days were recorded after each vaccination dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study. It also included any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination. Grade 3 AE = an AE which prevented normal, everyday activities. Related = AE assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination up to 30 days post last vaccination
primary_outcome.description: A Serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence that result in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation, results in disability/incapacity, or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject. Related = SAEs assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Related Potential Immune-mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination up to 30 days post last vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology. Related = pIMds assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Vaccine Response Rate (VRR) for Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by ELISA. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the cut-off for Anti-gE (4x97 mIU/mL). For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre -vaccination antibody concentration. This analysis was performed on subjects with haematologic malignancies, excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma.

Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).This parameter was assessed in subjects with haematologic malignancies, excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Occurrence of Any Confirmed HZ Case
secondary_outcome.description: Time to occurrence of any confirmed HZ case is expressed in terms of incidence rate of subjects with at least one event. Hence, person-year rate = number of episodes (n)/ sum of follow-up period (censored at the first occurrence of an event) expressed in years (T[year)]). Follow-up period starts Day 1 of vaccination. Any clinically suspected case of HZ (defined as (1) a new rash characteristic of HZ (e.g., unilateral, dermatomal and accompanied by pain broadly defined to include allodynia, pruritus or other sensations), or a vesicular rash suggestive of Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV) infection regardless of the distribution, and no alternative diagnosis; or (2) a clinical presentation (symptoms and/or signs) and specific laboratory findings suggestive of VZV infection in the absence of characteristic HZ or VZV rash.) The endpoint is confirmed in two ways: (1) By Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or (2) By the HZ Ascertainment Committee. The PCR is used as primary classification method.

Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL). This parameter was assessed in all vaccinated subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vaccine Response Rate (VRR) for Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by ELISA. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the cut-off for anti-gE (4x97 mIU/mL). For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre -vaccination antibody concentration. Vaccine response was measured in all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of gE -Specific Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) [2+] T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
secondary_outcome.description: Among markers expressed were interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), interleukin-2 (IL-2), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 ligand (CD40L), as determined by in vitro intracellular cytokine staining (ICS).

secondary_outcome.measure: Vaccine Response Rates (VRR) for gE-specific CD4 [2+] T-cells, Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
secondary_outcome.description: Among markers expressed were IFN-γ, IL-2, TNF-α and CD40L, as determined by in vitro ICS. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies below the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to the threshold (2x<320> Events/106 CD4+ T cells). For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies above the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination at Month 0 up to study end at Month 13
secondary_outcome.description: A Serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence that result in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation, results in disability/incapacity, or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject. Related = SAEs assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Potential Immune-mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination at Month 0 up to study end at Month 13
secondary_outcome.description: Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology

secondary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) of Anti-gE Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: GMCs of anti-gE antibodies were tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Geometric Increase (MGI) of Anti-gE Antibody ELISA Concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: MGI was tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status. MGI was defined as the Geometric mean of the within subject ratios of the post-vaccination reciprocal anti-gE concentration to the Month 0 reciprocal anti-gE concentration.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive the candidate HZ vaccine (GSK 1437173A).
Subjects will receive the placebo vaccine.

intervention.description: 2 doses administered intramuscularly (IM) in deltoid region of non-dominant arm. Dose 1 administered at Day 0. Dose 2 administered 1-2 months post Dose 1.
2 doses administered intramuscularly (IM) in deltoid region of non-dominant arm. Dose 1 administered at Day 0. Dose 2 administered 1-2 months post Dose 1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject.
- A male or female, aged 18 years or older at the time of study entry.
- Subject who has been diagnosed with one or more haematologic malignancies prior to the first vaccination and who is receiving, is scheduled to receive or has just finished immunosuppressive cancer therapy to treat this condition.
- Life expectancy greater than or equal to 12 months, as assessed by the investigator.
- Female subjects of non-childbearing potential may be enrolled in the study.
- Non-childbearing potential is defined as pre-menarche, current tubal ligation, hysterectomy, ovariectomy or post-menopause.
- Female subjects of childbearing potential may be enrolled inthe study, if the subject:
- has practiced adequate contraception for 30 days prior to vaccination, and
- has a negative pregnancy test on the day of vaccination, and
- has agreed to continue adequate contraception during the entire treatment period and for 2 months after completion of the vaccination series.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject diagnosed with chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL) who is receiving only oral cancer therapy (subject receiving intra-venous cancer therapy for CLL or intra-venous cancer therapy in combination with oral therapy may be enrolled).
- Subject receiving radiotherapy alone as treatment for his/her haematologic malignancy.
- Planned haematopoietic stem cell transplant (HCT) during the study period. (If a HCT occurred prior to enrolment in the study, the subject may not receive study vaccine until at least 50 days after the transplant procedure).
- Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection by clinical history.
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccine within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine/placebo, or planned use during the study period. However, the investigational use of a registered product to treat the subject's underlying disease, is allowed.
- Previous vaccination against HZ or varicella within the 12 months preceding the first dose of study vaccine/placebo.
- Planned administration during the study of a HZ or varicella vaccine (including an investigational or non-registered vaccine) other than the study vaccine.
- Occurrence of a varicella or HZ episode by clinical history within the 12 months preceding the first dose of study vaccine/placebo.
- History of any reaction or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine.
- Administration or planned administration of a live vaccine in the period starting 30 days before the first dose of study vaccine and ending 30 days after the last dose of study vaccine.
- Administration or planned administration of a non-replicating vaccine within 8 days prior to or within 14 days after either dose of study vaccine.
- Pregnant or lactating female.
- Female planning to become pregnant or planning to discontinue contraceptive precautions before Month 3 (i.e., 2 months after the last dose of study vaccine/placebo).

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of the 568 subjects enrolled, only 562 subjects received vaccination as per protocol and hence started the study.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

period.title: End of Study Phase (up to Month 13)

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Vaccine Response Rates (VRR) for Anti-glycoprotein E (Anti-gE) Antibody Concentrations
outcome.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA). Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 greater than or equal to (≥) 4 fold the cut-off for Anti-gE [4x97 milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL)]. For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody concentration. This analysis was performed on subjects with haematologic malignancies excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, who received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 2 visit.

analysis.groups_desc: The objective aimed to evaluate anti-gE humoral immune responses at Month 2 following a two-dose administration of the GSK1437173A vaccine, as compared to placebo, in subjects with haematologic malignancies excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma and Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The objective was met if the lower limit of the 95% CI of the Geometric Mean (GM) ratio (GSK1437173A vaccine over placebo) for anti-gE ELISA antibody concentrations at Month 2 was greater than (>) 3.
analysis.p_value_desc: The p-value is relative to the null hypothesis Ho: Vaccine / Placebo = 1

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 100 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered, who had their symptom sheets completed.

outcome.title: Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).This parameter was assessed in subjects with haematologic malignancies, excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 2 visit.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
measure.description: Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).This parameter was assessed in subjects with haematologic malignancies, excluding subjects with Non-Hodgkin B-cell Lymphoma.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 2 visit.

outcome.title: Time to Occurrence of Any Confirmed HZ Case
outcome.description: Time to occurrence of any confirmed HZ case is expressed in terms of incidence rate of subjects with at least one event. Hence, person-year rate = number of episodes (n)/ sum of follow-up period (censored at the first occurrence of an event) expressed in years (T[year)]). Follow-up period starts Day 1 of vaccination. Any clinically suspected case of HZ (defined as (1) a new rash characteristic of HZ (e.g., unilateral, dermatomal and accompanied by pain broadly defined to include allodynia, pruritus or other sensations), or a vesicular rash suggestive of Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV) infection regardless of the distribution, and no alternative diagnosis; or (2) a clinical presentation (symptoms and/or signs) and specific laboratory findings suggestive of VZV infection in the absence of characteristic HZ or VZV rash.) The endpoint is confirmed in two ways: (1) By Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or (2) By the HZ Ascertainment Committee. The PCR is used as primary classification method.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Time to Occurrence of Any Confirmed HZ Case
measure.description: Time to occurrence of any confirmed HZ case is expressed in terms of incidence rate of subjects with at least one event. Hence, person-year rate = number of episodes (n)/ sum of follow-up period (censored at the first occurrence of an event) expressed in years (T[year)]). Follow-up period starts Day 1 of vaccination. Any clinically suspected case of HZ (defined as (1) a new rash characteristic of HZ (e.g., unilateral, dermatomal and accompanied by pain broadly defined to include allodynia, pruritus or other sensations), or a vesicular rash suggestive of Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV) infection regardless of the distribution, and no alternative diagnosis; or (2) a clinical presentation (symptoms and/or signs) and specific laboratory findings suggestive of VZV infection in the absence of characteristic HZ or VZV rash.) The endpoint is confirmed in two ways: (1) By Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) or (2) By the HZ Ascertainment Committee. The PCR is used as primary classification method.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

outcome.title: Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
outcome.description: Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL). This parameter was assessed in all vaccinated subjects.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 13 visit.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
measure.description: Antibody concentrations were determined by ELISA, presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs) and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL). This parameter was assessed in all vaccinated subjects.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 13 visit.

outcome.title: Vaccine Response Rate (VRR) for Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
outcome.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by ELISA. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the cut-off for anti-gE (4x97 mIU/mL). For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre -vaccination antibody concentration. Vaccine response was measured in all subjects.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 13 visit.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Vaccine Response Rate (VRR) for Anti-gE Antibody Concentrations
measure.description: Vaccine response rate refers to the percentage of subjects with a vaccine response, as determined by ELISA. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially seronegative subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the cut-off for anti-gE (4x97 mIU/mL). For initially seropositive subjects, antibody concentration at Month 2 ≥ 4 fold the pre -vaccination antibody concentration. Vaccine response was measured in all subjects.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity, which included all subjects who met all eligibility criteria, received the full vaccination course, complied with the protocol and for whom data concerning immunogenicity outcome measures were available up to the Month 13 visit.

outcome.title: Frequency of gE -Specific Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) [2+] T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
outcome.description: Among markers expressed were interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), interleukin-2 (IL-2), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 ligand (CD40L), as determined by in vitro intracellular cytokine staining (ICS).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Cell-Mediated Immunogenicity (CMI), which included all evaluable subjects included in the ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity analyses and included in the CMI sub-cohort.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Frequency of gE -Specific Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) [2+] T-cells Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
measure.description: Among markers expressed were interferon-gamma (IFN-γ), interleukin-2 (IL-2), tumour necrosis factor-alpha (TNF-α) and cluster of differentiation 40 ligand (CD40L), as determined by in vitro intracellular cytokine staining (ICS).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Cell-Mediated Immunogenicity (CMI), which included all evaluable subjects included in the ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity analyses and included in the CMI sub-cohort.

outcome.title: Vaccine Response Rates (VRR) for gE-specific CD4 [2+] T-cells, Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
outcome.description: Among markers expressed were IFN-γ, IL-2, TNF-α and CD40L, as determined by in vitro ICS. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies below the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to the threshold (2x<320> Events/106 CD4+ T cells). For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies above the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Cell Mediated Immunity (CMI), which included all evaluable subjects included in the ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity analyses and included in the CMI sub-cohort.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Vaccine Response Rates (VRR) for gE-specific CD4 [2+] T-cells, Expressing at Least 2 Activation Markers
measure.description: Among markers expressed were IFN-γ, IL-2, TNF-α and CD40L, as determined by in vitro ICS. Vaccine response was defined as: For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies below the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to the threshold (2x<320> Events/106 CD4+ T cells). For initially subjects with pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies above the threshold, at least a 2-fold increase as compared to pre-vaccination T-cell frequencies.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the adapted ATP cohort for Cell Mediated Immunity (CMI), which included all evaluable subjects included in the ATP cohort for Humoral immunogenicity analyses and included in the CMI sub-cohort.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: A Serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence that result in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation, results in disability/incapacity, or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject. Related = SAEs assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination
outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination at Month 0 up to study end at Month 13
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

group.title: GSK1437173A Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

group.title: Placebo Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose).

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: A Serious adverse event (SAE) is any untoward medical occurrence that result in death, is life threatening, requires hospitalisation or prolongation of existing hospitalisation, results in disability/incapacity, or is a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject. Related = SAEs assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

class.title: At least one SAE, up to Month 6
At least one SAE, up to Month 13

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Potential Immune-mediated Diseases (pIMDs)
outcome.description: Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology
outcome.time_frame: From first vaccination at Month 0 up to study end at Month 13
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

measure.description: Potential immune-mediated diseases (pIMDs) are a subset of AEs that include autoimmune diseases and other inflammatory and/or neurologic disorders of interest which may or may not have an autoimmune aetiology
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with at least one vaccine dose administered.

outcome.title: Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) of Anti-gE Antibodies
outcome.description: GMCs of anti-gE antibodies were tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
outcome.population: This analysis was performed on the Cohort for correlate of protection, which included subjects from the Total vaccinated cohort receiving 2 vaccine doses and having no confirmed HZ-case before the Month 2 blood sampling.

group.title: GSK1437173A HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: GSK1437173A Non-HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with non-confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: Placebo HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: Placebo Non-HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with non-confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

measure.title: Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) of Anti-gE Antibodies
measure.description: GMCs of anti-gE antibodies were tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status and expressed in milli-international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).
measure.population: This analysis was performed on the Cohort for correlate of protection, which included subjects from the Total vaccinated cohort receiving 2 vaccine doses and having no confirmed HZ-case before the Month 2 blood sampling.

outcome.title: Mean Geometric Increase (MGI) of Anti-gE Antibody ELISA Concentrations
outcome.description: MGI was tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status. MGI was defined as the Geometric mean of the within subject ratios of the post-vaccination reciprocal anti-gE concentration to the Month 0 reciprocal anti-gE concentration.
outcome.population: This analysis was performed on the Cohort for correlate of protection, which included subjects from the Total vaccinated cohort receiving 2 vaccine doses and having no confirmed HZ-case before the Month 2 blood sampling, only on the subjects with available results at Month 2.

group.title: GSK1437173A HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: GSK1437173A Non-HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received GSK1437173A vaccine according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of study vaccine could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with non-confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: Placebo HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

group.title: Placebo Non-HZ Cases Sub-Group
group.description: Subjects who received placebo doses according to a 0, 1 Months schedule (The second dose of placebo could be administered 1 - 2 months after the first dose), with non-confirmed Herpes Zoster (HZ).

measure.title: Mean Geometric Increase (MGI) of Anti-gE Antibody ELISA Concentrations
measure.description: MGI was tabulated per study group and HZ confirmed/non-confirmed status. MGI was defined as the Geometric mean of the within subject ratios of the post-vaccination reciprocal anti-gE concentration to the Month 0 reciprocal anti-gE concentration.
measure.population: This analysis was performed on the Cohort for correlate of protection, which included subjects from the Total vaccinated cohort receiving 2 vaccine doses and having no confirmed HZ-case before the Month 2 blood sampling, only on the subjects with available results at Month 2.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
